li.a: Bob’s Blog: musings from the Superintendent
A Turning Point for Oregon Schools
GSD rated tops in Return on Investment
Chapter 2: Support plan will tie to student needs, goals

select.option: – Bob’s Blog: musings from the Superintendent
– A Turning Point for Oregon Schools
– GSD rated tops in Return on Investment
– Chapter 2: Support plan will tie to student needs, goals

div.p:
Kindergarten registration begins online April 23
Children who will be age 5 on or before September 1 are invited to enroll for kindergarten for the 2020-21 school year. Online Registration will open on April 23, 2020. For an overview of important points in this process, start here, then click on Online Registration to get started.

While there is no registration deadline, families are urged to register as soon as possible so teachers and staff can prepare to welcome new students. If you have any questions, contact school secretary Heidi Smith at smithh@gladstone.k12.or.us or leave a message at 503.496.3939.
Taking care of yourself is Job One!
In difficult and uncertain times, the most important thing you can do is take care of yourself. Here are some tips from GHS counselors on self care strategies to manage your stress and help you focus on the positive.

Website helps families with distance learning
We have a new resource for families figuring out distance learning. Learn:
• How to connect to the Internet
• How to check out a Chromebook
• How students in grades K-5 can access Seesaw
• How students in grades 6-12 can access Google Classroom

New Residents in Gladstone
If you recently moved to the Gladstone School District, to participate in our 2019-2020 school year distance learning program, you will need to register with the school. To register, email the school secretary:
Kindergarten — Gladstone Center for Children & Families
Heidi Smith: smithh@gladstone.k12.or.us
Grades 1-5 — John Wetten Elementary
Linda Alberico: albericol@gladstone.k12.or.us
Grades 6-8 — Kraxberger Middle School
Jennifer Bokenyi: bokenyij@gladstone.k12.or.us
Grades 9-12 — Gladstone High
Vicki Baker: bakerv@gladstone.k12.or.us

p.strong: GCCF provides free meals for kids
p.br:
Gladstone Schools has a new pickup schedule for grab & go meals. Stop by each Wednesday to pick up 5 breakfasts & 5 lunches per students. Drive through & walk up service is provided to protect social distancing. Children need not come with you.
Gladstone Center for Children & Families
18905 Portland Avenue
9 a.m. to noon every Wednesday

div.p: All Gladstone schools will be closed from Monday, March 16 through the end of the school year as part of a statewide school closure ordered by Oregon Governor Kate Brown to prevent the spread of the COVID-19 virus.

To prevent germs from spreading, please remind your child to wash hands thoroughly and often. Cough into a tissue or their sleeve. Anyone who is sick should stay home until 72 hours after symptoms subside.

p.strong: District plan for new funding based on public input
p.br:
The Student Success Act will bring Gladstone Schools over $1.4 million per year starting in fall 2020. The district plan for how to spend these funds to boost student achievement will be based on input from parents, staff and students gathered in fall 2019.
Find out more.

p.strong: Gladstone graduation rate hits historic high
p.br: Gladstone High School’s Class of 2019 had a district graduation rate of over 91%. The rate, a historic high, is more than 11% above the state average. “Over the past three years, new support programs and high-interest electives helped propel our graduation rate,” said Gladstone High principal Kevin Taylor. “As a small school with big opportunities, we are immensely proud of our students’ accomplishments.”

p.strong: GHS athletes achieve Academic All-State Honors
p.br: Two Gladstone High teams received recognition as athletes maintaining high academic achievement. The girls cross-country team had the state’s third best academic standing, with a 3.84 average grade point average. The football team also qualified for Academic All-State, with a 3.0 average grade point average.

a.title: Gladstone Center for Children and Families

p.br:
Superintendent Bob Stewart
Assistant Superintendent Jeremiah Patterson
